text: Kevin Burkhardt (born March 2, 1974) is an American sports broadcaster who calls games for the NFL on Fox with John Lynch and Erin Andrews. Burkhardt previously was a field reporter for New York Mets games on SportsNet New York. Burkhardt worked with Gary Cohen, Keith Hernandez and Ron Darling. He has also called New York Mets spring training games and New Jersey Jackals games. In June of 2012, he filled in for Gary Cohen for the first time during regular season. He hosted and reported for Mets Hot Stove, Mets Pre-Game Live, Mets Post-Game Live, and Mets Year in Review. Outside of baseball, he was a beat reporter for the New York Jets and provided sports reporting for Time-Warner Cable and WCBS-AM. Burkhardt also called college football and Dallas Cowboys games for the Compass Media Networks, where Burkhardt was paired with Danny White. ==References== Category:Major League Baseball broadcasters Category:College football broadcasters Category:National Football League broadcasters Category:Living people Category:1974 births
title: Kevin Burkhardt
